website_summaries.verdict: A basic, inexpensive model with a few known flaws.
pros: Great for basic tasks like mashing potatoes and making dough
cons: Appliance is difficult to stand up and easy to knock over

customer_reviews.title: Actually has a slow speed.
customer_reviews.text: Finally -- a hand mixer that actually has a slow speed! I know they all say "5 speed" or whatever, but that always means fast, faster and fastest. I bought this one thinking that it would probably have to be returned for that reason, but it's a keeper. As some of the reviewers have mentioned, the beaters don't go in or come out easily -- and sometimes shoot out and across the room -- but I'm getting the knack of that. It also doesn't balance on it's heel so it always falls over, but that's a small price to pay for a slow speed.
customer_reviews.author: Pat N

customer_reviews.title: Finally a slow speed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mixer after reading reviews on a whole lot of hand mixers. I was trying to find one that had a low speed that didn't fling cream cheese or butter all over the room when I was trying to cream ingredients together. Thanks to the reviewer that mentioned that this mixer had an actual SLOW speed for blending.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: odd but functional mixer.
customer_reviews.text: update: didn't last long -- but I'm hard on them and dropped this one, so there was a screw loose then the same thing happened with. $15 (unfamiliar brand) mixer I picked up at Walgreens. Recently bought a Black & Decker that is much much better and even has whisk attachments. original review: looks like a hybrid robot rabbit/military aircraft prototype and works fine, I wish the speed control direction was reversed (i'm left handed). there's a big round silver button on it that appears to do nothing but it makes you wonder. the extra "kneading" attachments could make interesting earrings or tree ornaments for someone obsessed with cooking
customer_reviews.author: VOTE HIM OUT

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months and just quit on me
customer_reviews.text: They worked good while I had them but I bought these last September and this is March 30 and they just quit on me one morning in the middle of making cookie dough. I guess I should keep a back up around. They just quit. Will be ordering something else this time around. The last pair of Osters with a 2500 watt motor lasted me 3 years, the beaters I had before that one belonged to my grandma for 30 years and I used it for 10 more years before it finally gave up the ghost. I guess even the manufacturers know that this world is about to end and these things don't need to last.
customer_reviews.author: tru2u

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: It fell apart in the heads of my 9 year old baker. The power button broke off. It didn't even last 6 months. The warranty through SunBeam is a joke. It takes three weeks, three applications, all reachly illustrated by required pictures. Being suck at home due to pandemic, with lots of time on my hand, I'm plowing through this process, but really, who has time to deal with this? It's an $18 dollar item! Well, you get what you pay for... I would rather spend extra $10 bucks and buy Cussinart mixer in metal enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: Pavlovsky

customer_reviews.title: Dough hooks don't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Amazon In April of 2015. It came with beaters and dough hooks. The mixer itself seems to work fine, but the dough hooks do not fit into the mixer, one simply will not stay in. Comparing the ends of the beaters and the dough hooks it is obvious that the beaters have a longer insert. Amazon still sells this mixer with dough hooks, but they are not offered here as a replacement part - probably since they don't work!
customer_reviews.author: Curtains

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the low price fool you!  It's great!
customer_reviews.text: This hand mixer has a artsy-design, is the perfect small-size, comes with two different sets of beaters, and is super light. I bought this as a back-up when my stand-mixer went down, but it actually beats cookie dough better than my Kitchenaid! I was surprised at the great quality of this little mixer!
customer_reviews.author: jenjorcar

customer_reviews.title: Falsehood
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t come with the dough mixer. Bummer!!! I would give it 5 stars because I really like it but as a custome I feel very disappointed, sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER FIRST USE...KNOB TO ADJUST SPEED BROKE OFF....JUNK! BUT AMAZON WAS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM WAS USELESS AFTER FIRST USE....THE SPEED KNOB BROKE SO NO WAY TO TURN IT ON BUT AMAZON SEND ME ANOTHER.....GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM AMAZON!
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer because I'm sick of my other mixer throwing flour all over my kitchen because it does not have a slow start. I love this mixer it starts slow and doesn't throw flour everywhere and will go fast enough to mix egg whites quickly. Beaters are a little hard to get in the slots and pretty hard to release also, but otherwise, I love this mixer. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: bowqueen4sam

customer_reviews.title: Low speed not low at all. Loud! Returned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for all the positive reviews about having a real "low speed". Not sure what people think is low speed but the one I received would start on 1 at a medium clip then get faster & faster as the mixer warmed up. Definitely not slow enough to blend without throwing flour or liquid all over and out of the bowl. On top of that, it is LOUD. Maybe ours was defective but I'm not taking a 2nd chance. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Golly

customer_reviews.title: Oyster 2500.....not good!
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well 1st 2 times I used it and then, the frickin' speed switch broke up turning it from low to hi. A small thin piece of plastic, really? I guess you get what you pay for but it was rated pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Jonemac

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction and unstable
customer_reviews.text: The curvey design leaves this mixer inherently unstable. The beaters are not identified for which hole they go into and don't lock in properly; they can be pulled out without pushing the lock release. Pretty noisy, too! If I still had the package, I would return it. I think I'd have gotten better value buying locally at my Walmart for less plus the ease of exchanging the item. I rarely have reason to leave negative reviews but I'd definitely NOT recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: ManuSchatz

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, poor design
customer_reviews.text: This mixer works great. HOWEVER, the poor design of the base makes it likely to tip over while resting upright. This is problematic if you want to set it down to add ingredients, it's likely to tip over dirtying the counter. Also the design makes it difficult to wrap the cord around it for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have owned this item since March and the motor ...
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this item since March and the motor is already burning up. This is not an appliance that is used everyday. In fact, once or twice a month is the norm. Not quality!!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Not gonna do!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it a few times, mixes ok and is fairly quiet. One dough hook works and the other won't fit the hole ....it's too big. Ok.....now this is really aggravating! Sits on a narrow pointy base. It fell over, turned on, and spewed cake batter everywhere! If I could return it I would!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to upgrade my old Oster and was happy to find out that my old beaters fit the new one. Thank you Oster! I needed dough hooks too and couldn't find them as a separate purchase, they came with this hand mixer. Also like the upgraded power options.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great quality hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Great quality hand mixer. I bought this for my daughter as she needed a new one. I had previously bought this same model for my wife and it's still going strong after about 5 years of hard use. We have had many other brands in the past, but they have not stood the test of time. We were only getting about a year between lesser quality mixers before I purchased this one for my wife. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: RC Mark

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and work
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and useful. Not a replacement for a KitchenAid but does a good job of mixing stuff. Dough hooks serviceable in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking
customer_reviews.text: In times of the pandemic, I, like many other people stuck at home, turned to baking. This product was quite good! It helps with beating the egg whites until stiff. I can imagine it being great at making a good dalgona/matcha coffee too. Happy so far :)
customer_reviews.author: Quan

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I can not get the 2nd beater to go into the hole. Even had someone else try and they could not get it inserted either. The mixer itself feels very cheap. I guess I should have spent more for better quality which I intend on doing. I am throwing this one in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L Tiedeman

customer_reviews.title: The Beat Goes On........
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to the longevity of this mixer but I am having fun using it. Whips up mashed taters, egg whites, waffle and pancake batters and everything else I've tried. Haven't used the bread hooks yet. Seems powerful enough and it certainly is priced for my budget. Living and traveling in a motor home, there just isn't the room for a large mixer. This stores in a small space and gets the job done for me. Will post my lament later if it doesn't hold up. So far no strange smells while mixing heavy stuff. Motor doesn't slow appreciably and at this time all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Garage Junkie

customer_reviews.title: works great. im quite impressed with the dough hooks
customer_reviews.text: works great. im quite impressed with the dough hooks. good mixer for the price. good quality. has 3 speeds witch are great because you can start off slow and not sling flour everywhere?
customer_reviews.author: AwallsRN

customer_reviews.title: Great for bread!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is so cheap for what you get. i've never had a hand mixer stand up to bread dough without rapidly overheating before. The mixer can run for 2-5 min in thick dough before you start to get a 'metal' smell, the precursor to it burning it. now that i know how long it can go, I plan around it and don't think it'll burn out too soon. It fully kneads two loaves worth of dough in about 4 minutes. 4/5 because the lowest speed is higher than expected and this reduces its versatility a little bit. the highest speed is fantastic for frostings, though, so it may be a fair trade off
customer_reviews.author: Grant Syrin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small batch mixer - not for stiff whipped cream
customer_reviews.text: Very nice light easy to use hand mixer. If you are looking for something to make very stiff whipped cream, this is not the tool for you. However, for 99% of all other applications small batch batters, mousse, mixing and blending this one is perfect. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M.

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than most!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time tonight and love, love, love it! Soooo much quieter than the Black and Decker I had! Plenty of power, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BlueDogsBSK

customer_reviews.title: Noisy & doesn’t stand well when not in use
customer_reviews.text: It’s noisy! Makes a high-pitched whine no matter what speed it’s on. Didn’t bother replacing it since it replaced another poorly made one. At least this one will mix cookie batter. The other one blew the motor on simple cookie batter. This does not stand well on it’s own.
customer_reviews.author: Bett

customer_reviews.title: excellent mixer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mixer for the price, the dough hook is a nice attachment. Almost 1 month using this mixer at least 3 times a week and still thinking that this mixer was the correct choice compared to others with similar options and higher price. 5 speeds with real slow or 1 speed so you don't have problems at the beginning of the mixing.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhh....
customer_reviews.text: Wow... this mixer is a life saver. My old mixer literally reduced me to child-like tantrums because of it's splattering and inability to beat eggs whites properly. Ask my husband, he ducked for cover when I threw the stupid thing across the kitchen (not a normal reaction for modest, conservative me) The Oster 2500 is great. Simple, effective...and has a SLOW setting. I've been mixing, whipping, and blending like a maniac ever since I got this puppy in the mail. No, it's not a KitchenAid, but I don't have a KitchenAid budget, and this little mixer does the trick for less than $30!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great power for a little mixer; two design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy the mixer is to use. The speeds starts off nice and slow---much appreciated. I also like the speed of the fastest setting. The two things that annoy me are that the beaters can be a little tricky seating them in the mixer, and that when you stop the mixer and go to sit it on its bottom (beaters up) it tends to fall over, making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Does not meet the standard
customer_reviews.text: This mixer barely lasted us 2 weeks. When beating egg whites and cake batter, it was terrific. However, when using the dough hooks to make cookies, the mixer stopped. The cookie batter wasn't tough, it was chocolate chip cookie batter, the mixer stopped working during the mixing of the chocolate chips. Don't be fooled by the specifications of this mixer. Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Chen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little mixer.
customer_reviews.text: For now I am giving the mixer four stars, because the beater release is very stiff. If it loosens up with use, I will change to five stars. I really love the many speeds. For the first time I don't have to drape a towel over the bowl, because the low speed mixes without spraying all over. It is nice and sturdy and can sit on its back. I did balance it on the edge of the bowl for a few minutes even though I am not sure if it will slip off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Still works great.
customer_reviews.text: About 2 years later and it still works great my only gripes are these: 1) I wish the cord was a couple of inches longer since our kitchen just happens to have outlets in weird places that don't make sense, probably just me on that one. 2) It can be difficult to get the beaters out as the release button can get a little tough to push at times. This is why I removed a star. I wish the release button for the beaters didn't require so much effort. Someone with arthritis might have a hard time pushing down with as much pressure as needed to get those beaters out to be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Heather HW.

customer_reviews.title: I received this Oster Inspire hand mixer right away and ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this Oster Inspire hand mixer right away and I was very impressed with that, also, It comes with dough hooks which I have not yet used. I do plan to make some bread and see how well they work but this is a 240 Watt 5 speed mixer so it should be able to handle it okay. I have used the regular mixing blades it comes with when I used it to mix some egg whites into a stiff foam and it performed very well, it's much faster than my old hand mixer which had fewer watts.
customer_reviews.author: KS2014

customer_reviews.title: like it!
customer_reviews.text: after years of my mom owning our old Oster hand mixer that she got at a yard sale before i was born (19 years ago) it finally broke down on us and we got this one! My mother really despised it at first because she found the beaters challenging to put in the first 2 tries but now we got the hang of it it isnt hard at all.. we like the "Burst" button for that moment you need a bit more speed love it so far simple/ straight forward to use
customer_reviews.author: brenda :)

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Went to use it thanksgiving and the beaters would not go in! Had to mash 5 pounds of potatoes by hand with a fork! Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This just doesn't get the job done. I couldn't even beat heavy cream to consistency of whipped cream. Furthermore, beaters are very flimsy and hard to attach. I would return, but I no longer have the box. I should have tested it immediately upon arrival. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: theresa hicks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great powerful mixer. Mixes real well no complaints it's a workhorse. Would recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Hand held mixer
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get beaters in and takes more pressure to change speeds. Have arthritis in my wrists and thumb, not a wise purchase. The good thing is the speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: underpowered, bad smell
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, but barely. The highest speed is comparable to medium-low on other hand mixers I've used. It also smells like burning plastic every time I use it, even on thin batters where it definitely shouldn't be straining.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lind

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: when our old one burned out we needed something to replace it. This works good - little hooks are useless.
customer_reviews.author: catsrus

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good inexpensive hand mixer. Easy enough for a 4 year old to handle and learn how to change speed (with adult supervision)
customer_reviews.author: TrueCrimer

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish the darn beaters weren't so very hard to eject ... gotta use gorilla force on the eject button while pulling on the beaters?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good outweighs the bad
customer_reviews.text: I love the different speeds! My last mixer had 5 places to click for speeds, but it really only operated at one speed. That's the 4 stars. Oh! and it's quiet! Otherwise, I find the unit rather bulky, and I hate that it doesn't sit well when you want to rest it on the counter. You have to rest it on the side of the bowl. But the speeds outweigh the negatives - absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer works great for me. I'm not trying to mix anything too exciting, just brownie and cake mixes. But it gets the job done. I had a hard time getting the mixers into the slots the first couple of times. But now that I've used it a couple of times they slip in much easier. They come out very easily with just a push of the button, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Cami

customer_reviews.title: Bought it twice because I liked it so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago and it has served me admirably when I don't want to pull out the heavy stand mixer. Now my son is living in an apartment and he needs a mixer and they're still selling this reliable model.
customer_reviews.author: juditha

customer_reviews.title: Best hand mixer.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed a lot of hand mixers and finally settled on this one. I have been very pleased with it. I don't use it a whole lot but it is no problem to use. The blades do pop out easily and is not a problem as some people had mentioned. It also stands up, and the low speed does not splash everything all over, but still powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Such an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Our last blender was a cheap one my husband got when he moved out on his own 6 or more years ago so it was time for a new one. Love that this has a slow speed, our old junker was like one speed despite the various speed settings. Whipped cream takes no time! The only draw back is definitely the complaints of getting the attachments out. The button is shaped at an angle plus very difficult to push, I have to press it against the counter to get it to work. Otherwise is great!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Oster blender
customer_reviews.text: made bread with dough hooks, had to move it around some but very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: cookiehha

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after the third use!
customer_reviews.text: The motor stopped working after the third time it was used, and there is no way to fix it or return it. Buy a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Mahjabeen

customer_reviews.title: ... I bought this) is that the slow speed is excellent. It's so nice to be able to slowly ...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have mentioned (and one of the reasons I bought this) is that the slow speed is excellent. It's so nice to be able to slowly mix ingredients before you crank up the speed so you don't wind up with a mess. I also bought this for the dough hooks, but we haven't had an opportunity to used them yet. The one item we make that always clogged up our previous mixer that would be better with the hooks is one that we only make in December.
customer_reviews.author: hound_dog_34

customer_reviews.title: Peter 2500 hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. It’s easy to hold and actually has a slow speed which is why I bought it in the first place. I find it relatively quiet
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beaters rust and break FAST
customer_reviews.text: Mixer works great after using it at most 4 times a month for the last 18 months the beaters rusted and broke.. I guess you get what you pay for. My last Mixer lasted 18 years.,
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Graser

customer_reviews.title: Great for the forearm if you need the conditioning
customer_reviews.text: Way to heavy for a hand mixer. Think about lifting weights while you mix. Great for the forearm if you need the conditioning, but not expected or nice for just mixing. Liken it to holding a stand mixer in 1 arm
customer_reviews.author: ERM

customer_reviews.title: Only flaw is that it doesn't stand up well and hard to eject
customer_reviews.text: A good, powerfull mixer. I haven't had a chance to test with heavy cookie dough yet but I'm sure it will be fine. The only flaws, and the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5: 1) It does not stand up well. You should be able to put down a mixer and have it stand up. 2) It's hard to eject the mixers. This is more of an annoyance but if your hands are week for orthopedic reasons it will be an issue
customer_reviews.author: David Bland

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2. One for neice and one for sister. Haven't received any baked goods from them yet?? lol
customer_reviews.author: Kim from WI

customer_reviews.title: great except the metal on the beaters is peeling off
customer_reviews.text: Love the mixer and have used it twice already. It's runs quietly and is up to the mixing tasks with ease so far. However, today when washing the beaters I saw something out of place shining and upon closer examination- one beater had metal peeling off the bottom and loosely flaking off. Now I am afraid to use it. I'm willing to pay more for a quality product made in USA. PS-Oster sent me a replacement set of beaters at no charge. So far they are not peeling. Thanks for standing behind your product!
customer_reviews.author: wvjessica

customer_reviews.title: keeps on ticking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for myself a few years back and it's still working. I see that as important because these days it seems such things often need replacing. Like the use I'm getting out of it so well, that I bought a 2nd for a Christmas gift (for my sister who seems to break things. lol)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Howard

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Will not sit on end easily. Sometimes hard to put the beaters in. More hassle than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: MARY NICOL

customer_reviews.title: great mixer
customer_reviews.text: works well, not heavy and love the option to use other beaters
customer_reviews.author: PTamborlane

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I'll have to send it back. I don't have access to a printer right now that's why I haven't done it yet. Not sure if it's an isolated item but I think I'm better off getting my money back. This is the first time I've ever had a problem with anything I've ever bought through Amazon. I have always been pleased with the condition and promptness of deliveries.
customer_reviews.author: Trailnut

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cuisinart hand mixer that I can only use for whipping eggs whites and a few other tasks, because the lowest speed is set to "Jet Engine". I was looking for a regular hand mixer with a real low speed that I could use to whip potatoes, cream, etc. without ending up with food all over my cupboards. This one is great. It does a wonderful job on all speeds, and I haven't experienced the problem a few others complained about of the beater eject button not working correctly. I've used it for a few weeks, and would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: andreas_books_

customer_reviews.title: Neat Little Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: When I don't need the big hulking stand mixer, this is the perfect go to. It is small and easy to handle but it has all the power you need. The beaters are easy to install and remove and the shape of the mixer is really unique. I bought this to replace a different mixer that had no slow speed, I was always splattering batter all over the kitchen. This one has a good slow speed which is very important when you're incorporating dry ingredients into wet. Seems sturdy enough to last a long time. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: S. L. CHANCE

customer_reviews.title: It's a blender.
customer_reviews.text: It's a no frills, solid little kitchen appliance. It doesn't feel cheap, but it's not the Cadillac of kitchen appliances either. So far I am satisfied, though. If, through use, it fails to live up to my initial satisfaction, I will be sure to edit this review to reflect that, so if you are reading this, the older my review gets, the more sincere I am about the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Snowman

customer_reviews.title: It’s good for price
customer_reviews.text: Does ok... expected a little more ump...but was able to make my cheesecake. Just took a bit longer to combine ingredients
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Poor mad
customer_reviews.text: My old Rival is getting too noisy and slow. It is old, I had it for 16 years. I decides to replace it before it completely dies on me. Oster 2500 had good reviews so I purchased it. Right away I noticed that item is not made very well, it makes very high pitch noise and one of the spinners is vibrating too much. I do not think it will last long. Giving a 2 star for now since it still did a job.
customer_reviews.author: YaneyaArt

customer_reviews.title: This mixer is the best!! Great value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hand mixer that started slowly and gradually built up speed as needed. One that didn't blow flour all over the place. Well, I found it !! This mixer is the best !! Great value, does what I need it to do. Would buy it again !!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Marie

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews about this product before I purchased it. I was concerned about one review that stated she couldn't push the release button to eject the beaters because I have issues with my hands as well. I really wanted to try this model because of the dough attachments as they would come in handy for me. I will say the first time I used this mixer the button was easy to push in. Every time after I can still push in the release button myself so I'm very happy about that. The dough attachments work wonderfully! I am very happy with this product and would buy it again and recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rick

customer_reviews.title: Will be ok for a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: Something rattles inside this machine. I'm not sure if that will prove to be a problem later. The major drawback is that the slowest speed is still very fast so it's hard to start it without splattering mixture everywhere, but for basic baking tasks it seems to be holding up fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: VHG

customer_reviews.title: A Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I am well satisfied with my Oster 2500 Inspire 240 Watt 5-speed hand mixer. It has plenty of power to mix stiff dough and helps me to make cookies and other baked goods. It is a good value for the money and easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeaneen Simek

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but very noisy
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer mentioned, the lowest power is quite fast but it is a powerful mixer. The blades seem to be nicely snug which is a problem with others I've had. But it is very noisy. And the bottom that is supposed to be the rest is narrow and the mixer is precarious when put in that position. I've had good Oster blenders which, along with the low price is why I chose this. Using it at our beach house so won't have to put up with the drawbacks all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Murray

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This mixer broke after 2 months. Maybe used it 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Horrell

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery. Good product. Works great. Just wish it came in some kind of pouch or case or something, to keep all things together.
customer_reviews.author: Bluetattoo72

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer, no need to spend a lot of $
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my vintage Sunbeam. And by vintage, I just mean old and crusty. This one works great so far, and for the price, it's fantastic. I couldn't figure out how to get the 2nd beater in at first until I realized that they are actually specific to the left and right holes. Once I figured that out, I whipped up banana bread in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Leemon

customer_reviews.title: A real Handfull
customer_reviews.text: AT LAST! A single mixer with a rechargable battery to replace my old Black & Decker that I used until it would no longer toke a charge any more (after about 3 decades). Hope it lasts as long as I do!
customer_reviews.author: George Lamar

customer_reviews.title: Really glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I got this. Originally got it to make a whipped body butter, and then realized I needed it for cookies. It worked very well for both, although when mixing the sugar cookies I mixed the last cup of flour by hand because I wasn't sure how much this mixer could handle. I haven't used a hand mixer in years, and the last one I used was more than likely at least 20 yrs old. This one works well, and shouldn't fling batter around on low if you have an appropriately sized bowl. There is a bit of a trick to hitting the eject button at the right angle to make it easiest to press
customer_reviews.author: Adellia Baker

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job at mixing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mixer 4 months ago based on reviews. It does a great job at mixing....all speeds including SLOW. I too have arthritis in my hands, but do not seem to have any issues with the release button for the beaters. The base is a little tippy but you just can't be in a big rush when you set it down. I really like the swan shape...it just makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: WILBUR

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, heavy, but not balance nor will it cstand without it turning over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! The vent in the front does suck ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The vent in the front does suck up flour, etc very easily though, so I'm hoping that does not shorten it's life span.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Lachut

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The picture does not give this justice. It is a pearly white and works beautifully. Easy to hold and clean. Cannot recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Really has slow speed
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most hand mixers, this one really does have a slow speed that is almost slow. It could be a bit slower but it's much better than its predecessor. The beaters are difficult to eject (and not that easy to put in, either) but my primary reason for buying this was the reviews that promised a slower speed, so I'm not unhappy with this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: RandiG

customer_reviews.title: THUMB OF ATLAS
customer_reviews.text: You need the thumb of Atlas to release the beaters. We inserted them and almost couldn't remove them- back it went to Amazon- thank God for their wonderful return policy. I can't tell you how well or poorly it works- we didn't even try that after discovering how hard it was to release the beaters.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been into making cookies for the holiday season. I didn't have any kind of mixer so I set out finding one that was of quality and hopefully wasn't too hard on our budget. I'm very happy to say that this was it. It didn't have a problem with the cookie dough, which can be quite a task manually. It cleaned up well, and I didn't have any problems with it. I have only had it for about a month 1/2, so if it breaks down, I'll let you know! As of right now, it's perfect for what I need it for and am happy for the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: as expected. In expensive and works as expected w/out ...
customer_reviews.text: as expected. In expensive and works as expected w/out a lot of bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: major problem is getting the darn beaters in and out...when they are in they're great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Okay for light mixing. But first time I used the dough hooks one broke in half. Replaced it. Second time I used them the plastic part that holds them into the mixer broke. Plus I didn’t like that it won’t stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I had read some reviews of hand mixers that mentioned how heavy they were. Went to the store to have a look, and lo and behold, some of those suckers weigh as much as a small bowling ball (how absurd - your arm would get so tired from holding them). Anyways, this mixer is relatively lightweight but still has plenty of power. I especially like the extra slow 1st speed, cuz it keeps the flour from flying all over the kitchen counter. Still haven't used the dough hooks - will post an update when I finally give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Luckyduck

customer_reviews.title: works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do the job, and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: F. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Speed Contol Knob Broke
customer_reviews.text: We have had this mixer for about 2 1/2 months and have used it daily but today the knob that allows you to control the speed, broke off. The plastic portion that is down inside the mixer snapped and you can no longer control the speed.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna T.

customer_reviews.title: I can't wait to use this mixer for my cookies ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't wait to use this mixer for my cookies. But mom really rather me not play with her birthday gift. LOL. She cannot stop going on about how the speed, accuracy of product usage from Oster were spot on. Thank you users of Amazon be more detailed than I am because this is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Phillips BookWorm

customer_reviews.title: Low Speed-No Splatters!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a mixer with an actual low speed setting. Flour & batter stay inside bowl. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Robin D

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this with some hesitation, since some reviewers were critical of its ability to stand on its end and of difficulty in ejecting beaters. I found no problem with either of those. The mixer is efficient, easy to use and easy to store. A great alternative to hauling out my big heavy duty mixer for all but the really big mixing jobs.
customer_reviews.author: swilliams

customer_reviews.title: Really DOES Have a Slow Speed
customer_reviews.text: My old hand mixer makes a mess when I want to use a slow speed so I purchased this one in hopes that it would work without having dry or wet ingredients flying all over the place. It's perfect!! I'd give it 5 stars except for storage, tends to tip over in the cupboard but "doesn't make a mess".
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Oster reliable as always
customer_reviews.text: Nice mixer, only problem was getting beaters in..difficult to begin with..after using several times it is easier but still slightly difficult. You have twist and push forcefully.
customer_reviews.author: msmomma

customer_reviews.title: Speed Adjuster Not Vertical
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Enormous but not heavy Powerful Quiet Doesn't vibrate or push against your hand much Cons: Bigger than average (not really a con, just something to be aware of) The Speed Setting knob goes horizontally across the handle, making it hard to change with one hand. I think this is its biggest defect.
customer_reviews.author: Allison N Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible mixer. This one will compare with far more expensive models and still come out on top. I bought this because I have an Oster blender that is bullet-proof. I mean, very sturdy and durable. This mixer seems to be cut from the same cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Cajetan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This mixer doesn't compare to my old Oster mixer that recently broke. The beaters are very flimsy and one bent and broke on the second use. The design is horrible. It won't stand on it's end very well (tipping over). I find that I have to use my second hand to use the speed button (whereas I could adjust the speed with the same hand while using the mixer). That may sound trivial, but it isn't very convenient. And, as previously mentioned, the beater eject button does not work. I have to yank the beaters out of the mixer. This will be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great little hand mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little mixer. Has all the power, and speed I need.
customer_reviews.author: Betka612

customer_reviews.title: Tough buttons
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mixer for smaller jobs that don't require pulling out the big stand mixer. My only quibble is with the placement of the buttons. The switch to adjust the speed is quite small relative to the "burst of power" button just under it and it requires an awkward left-to-right motion that's hard to do with one hand. It would be better if the location of those two buttons were reversed. An up-and-down motion for the speed, with the capability of doing it with my thumb, would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: TKS

customer_reviews.title: Hard to eject beaters.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little blender. Attachments are good. Very hard to eject. If I had to do it again I would probably spend more for something a bit more compact with easier controls/buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Mel C

product_meta.title: Oster 2500 Inspire 240-Watt 5-Speed Hand Mixer, White
feature_bullets: Ergonomic design contour grip for ease and comfort
Burst-of-Power function provides extra mixing power to work through batters and ensure even mixing at any speed
One-touch beater eject makes clean up quick and easy
Includes chrome beaters and dough hooks

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,073 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
